alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Hoke; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 1:09PM EDT until June 22 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Harnett, Hoke, Moore and Sampson. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 104 PM EDT, waves of widespread rain with embedded heavier cells moved across the area over the past hour or two. Much of this widespread rain has moved northeast of the area but additional thunderstorms may move across the area over the next hour. One to two inches of rain has fallen across the area today with some localized spots receiving close to 3 inches. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to a half inch to an inch are possible. expected over the area. This additional rain combined with runoff from previous precipitation will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Clinton, Raeford, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Harrells, Godwin, Pope AFB, Antioch, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Garland, Newton Grove, Wade, Salemburg and Turkey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
